intro: Leontodon alpinus, commonly known as the alpine hawk’s-beard, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy alpine habitats, thriving in cold climates. It has a taproot system and produces achenes as its fruit. Leontodon alpinus is often found in open, sunny areas at high altitudes.
